name: Big LA's Liquor Store
details: LIQUOR STORE. Across the street from Pam's Gift Shop.

name: Bristol Cellars
details: LIQUOR STORE. Located on Cupid's Cay, also called Bacardi's due to the giant logo on the facade, known for their wine selection.

name: Burrow's One Stop Liquors
details: LIQUOR STORE. Recently relocated from up the hill, now next to Burrow's grocery store.

name: Butler and Sands
details: LIQUOR STORE. Near the Shell station in town, next to the First Caribbean Bank.

name: Gene's Bay Liquor Store
details: LIQUOR STORE. The last chance to pick up alcohol on the way to the dry island of Spanish Wells.

name: Jimmy's
details: LIQUOR STORE. Across the street from the North Eleuthera Airport. Open Mon-Sat, 10a-6p, Visa/MC accepted.

name: Mr. Bones Wine and Spirits
details: LIQUOR STORE. Located behind the graveyard, turn East at the intersection just North of Pam's Gift Shop.

name: Pyfrom's Liquor Store
details: LIQUOR STORE. Easily found and often used as a landmark for travel due to the bright yellow paint on the building.

name: Ronnie's Hi-D Way
details: LIQUOR STORE, sports bar, and smoke shop. Live music on select nights.

name: Sturrups Liquor Store
details: LIQUOR STORE. Located in the Market Place Shopping Center.

name: North Eleuthera Airport
details: TRANSPORT. The northernmost airport, ELH, receives the majority of the foreign visitors to the island. Outside of the terminal, taxi service to Harbour Island water transport is readily available. Across the street you will find snacks and beverages.

name: Governor's Harbour Airport
details: TRANSPORT. The central airport, GHB, is closest to most vehicle rental agents and generally allows avoidance of car delivery fees. Some snacks are available inside the terminal, while a bar is just outside.

name: Rock Sound Airport
details: TRANSPORT. The southernmost airport, RSD, receives the least amount of foreign travelers.

name: Three Islands Dock
details: TRANSPORT. Water taxi transportation to Harbour Island Government Dock. Rates are $5 per person and are readily available during the daylight hours.

name: Harbour Island Government Dock
details: TRANSPORT. Water taxi transportation to Three Islands Dock on Eleuthera. Rates are $5 per person and are readily available during the daylight hours.

name: Gene's Bay Dock
details: TRANSPORT. Sometimes spelled 'Jean's,' this Northwest dock provides water taxi transportation to Spanish Wells for $5 per passenger.

name: Spanish Wells Dock
details: TRANSPORT. Water taxi dock for return transportation to Gene's Bay Dock.

name: Governor's Harbour Ferry Dock
details: TRANSPORT. Landing point for the Bahamas Ferries serving Nassau.

name: Cape Eleuthera Marina
details: TRANSPORT. Has water, electricity, and fuel, with capacity for up to 200' boats.

name: Davis Harbour Marina
details: TRANSPORT. Accommodates boats up to 80' with water, electricity, and fuel hookups. Called Davis Harbour @ Cotton Bay, this marina is actually on the 'Caribbean' side of the island, about 2 miles southwest of Cotton Bay.

name: Royal Bank of Canada
details: Open Monday-Thursday 930a-3p, Friday 930a-430p

name: First Caribbean Bank
details: Open Monday-Thursday 9a-3p, Friday 9a-4p

name: Scotia Bank - RS
details: Open Moday-Thursday 830a-430p, Friday 9a-5p

name: Da Perk
details: COFFEE $, The only coffee shop on mainland Eleuthera, also serves sandwiches and snacks. Indoor/outdoor seating, air-conditioned, with free wifi. Open Monday-Saturday 7a-4p.

name: Cocoa Coffee House
details: COFFEE $, The only coffee shop on Harbour Island, open Monday-Saturday 8a-4p, serves Starbucks.

name: North Eleuthera Shopping Center
details: GROCERY. One of the largest grocery stores on the island, also called Burchies. Mon-Thu 8am-8pm, Fri-Sat 8am-9pm, Sun 7am-10am

name: Burrow's One Stop Shop
details: GROCERY. Open Monday-Friday 6a-6p, Saturday 6a-7p, Sunday 6a-10a

name: Eleuthera Supply
details: GROCERY. Open Monday-Thursday 6a-6p, Friday 6a-630p, Saturday 6a-730p, Sunday 6a-3p

name: Governor's Harbour Bakery
details: DINING $. Open Monday-Friday 7a-5p, Saturday 7a-2p

name: 7 Eleven
details: GROCERY. Open daily 6a-9p, sells groceries and electronics

name: Big Rock General
details: GROCERY. Just outside of Rainbow Bay, next to... the big rock.

name: Johnson's Grocery Store
details: GROCERY. Open daily 6a-10p

name: Island Farm
details: GROCERY. The best source for fresh fruit, vegetables, spices, and on select days breads. Open Monday-Saturday 9a-4p

name: Millard's Variety Store
details: GROCERY. Small store on the right as you head north from the 4-way intersection.

name: Lakia's Variety Store
details: GROCERY. Open Monday-Saturday 6a-9p, Sunday 6a-11a

name: The Market
details: GROCERY. Open Monday/Tuesday/Thursday 8a-5p, Wednesday 8a-2p, Friday/Saturday 8a-7p

name: Bert's for the Best
details: GROCERY. Small store right along the main road near the pier.

name: Sharil's Restaurant
details: DINING $$. The only dining for miles, serves american and seafood dishes, call for current menu items, prepare for a wait.

name: Freedom Restaurant and Sushi Bar
details: DINING $$$. Located at The Cove, serves elegant dishes for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The closest thing to fine dining on the island.

name: Gregory Town Grill
details: DINING $$. Located at The Cove, serves Mexican inspired dishes.

name: The Laughing Lizard Cafe
details: DINING $. Open Monday-Saturday for breakfast and lunch, serves light fare such as soup, salad, and sandwiches

name: Ida's Delights
details: DINING $. Ice cream!

name: Surfers Manor Restaurant and Bar
details: DINING $. American and Bahamian breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

name: Daddy Joe's Restaurant and Bar
details: DINING $$. Live music on select nights.

name: The Bistro
details: DINING $$$. Elegant beachfront dining room and bar. Serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Bar features swim-up seating from the infinity pool. Covered seating in dining room and bar.  Credit cards are accepted.

name: Buccaneer Club
details: DINING $$. Indoor and outdoor seating on the patio, serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

name: Harbour Inn Restaurant
details: DINING $. Local eatery for casual takeaway.

name: Sunset Inn Restaurant and Bar
details: DINING $$. indoor seating or sunset views from the outdoor patio, closed on Thursdays.

name: Banks Road Deli
details: DINING $. Featuring meats and cheeses to take home, as well as sandwiches and other light fare. The deli shares space with the Pineapple Fields front desk and also contains some of their branded merchandise. Credit cards are accepted.

name: Tippy's
details: DINING $$. Casual beachfront dining with a chalkboard menu featuring American style entrees. Reservations recommended for dinner. Credit cards are accepted.

name: The Beach House Restaurant and Tapas Bar
details: DINING $$$. Set on French Leave Beach, open for lunch Monday-Sunday, reservations required for dinner on Monday and Thursday. Credit cards accepted.

name: Twin Brothers Seafood and Steakhouse
details: DINING $$. Outdoor seating and bar for lunch, dinner, and drinks.

name: The Front Porch
details: DINING $$$. Known for their great food and water views. Open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner, reservations encouraged.

name: Waters Edge Cafe
details: DINING $. Internet cafe open Monday-Saturday, also provides computer services.

name: Kel-d's Bar and Grill
details: DINING $$. Local hangout, serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Nondescript structure is easy to miss, watch for undersea mural on building.

name: Stubbs BBQ
details: DINING $. BBQ lunch on Fridays and Saturday starting at 11am. Show up early before they sell out.

name: Seven Seas
details: DINING $$. Local eatery with bar style menu for lunch and dinner.

name: Unique Village Restaurant and Bar
details: DINING $$. Indoor and ocean view outdoor seating. Open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Live music on Tuesday nights.

name: Mate and Jenny's
details: DINING $$. Open Wed-Mon for lunch and dinner. Serves fresh-made pizza, credit cards are accepted

name: The Rainbow Inn Seafood, Steakhouse, and Bar
details: DINING $$$. Open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner, serves seafood, steak, and pasta dishes using ingredients grown in their own garden. Pizza on Monday nights, live music select nights. Indoor/outdoor seating with ocean views. Credit cards are accepted.

name: DJ's Take-a-Way
details: DINING $. Local carry-out next to Big Rock General.

name: Rock Sound Club
details: DINING $$. Indoor dining, has small bar area. Open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

name: Pascal's Caribbean Fusion
details: DINING $$. Located at the 4 Points Marina Village, Pascal's offers traditional and eclectic plates with prime water views at tables or the large bar. Serves lunch and dinner. Popular restaurant for cruise ship passengers.

name: Sammy's Place
details: DINING $$. Affordable breakfast, lunch, and dinner options are available for dine-in or carry-out. Popular for picnic lunches at southern beaches.

name: Barbie's Snacks and Notions
details: DINING $$. local cuisine, open daily for lunch, dinner, and takeaway.

name: Shantzii's Seafood Restaurant and Sports Bar
details: DINING $$. Karaoke on Thursday nights.

name: Sip Sip
details: DINING $$$. Indoor/outdoor seating, known for great food with a view of the water. Open for lunch, closed on Tuesdays.

name: Queen Conch
details: DINING $$. Popular roadside eatery serving tasty seafood. Outdoor seating over the water. Open for lunch and dinner.

name: Governor's Harbour Boat Ramp
details: FRESH FISH. Buy the catch of the day when the fishermen return around 3PM.

name: Tarpum Bay Fishing Pier
details: FRESH FISH. Buy the catch of the day when the fishermen return around 3PM.

name: James Cistern Fishing Pier
details: FRESH FISH. Buy the catch of the day when the fishermen return around 3PM.

name: Pam's Island Made Gifts
details: SHOPPING. Mon-Sat, 9am-5pm, island paintings, ornaments, sauces, and numerous souvenirs of Eleuthera. Typically stocks a great road map.

name: Clipper Imports Boutique and Gifts
details: SHOPPING. Fashions, jewelry, and gifts, open Monday-Saturday 11a-4p.

name: Norma's Gift Shop
details: SHOPPING. Gifts, souvenirs, shirts, and beachwear. Open Monday-Saturday 9a-6p.

name: The Harbour Boutique
details: SHOPPING. Open Monday-Friday 12p-5p, Saturday 10a-5p. Carries womens clothing and locally made gifts.

name: Treasures of the Sea
details: SHOPPING. Open Monday-Saturday 8a-4p.

name: The Beach House Boutique
details: SHOPPING. Beachwear, artwork, jewelry and more. Open Monday/Thursday 12p-9p, Tuesday-Wednesday / Friday-Saturday 12p-5p, Sunday 12p-3p.

name: Rebecca's Beach Shop
details: SHOPPING. Open daily. Assorted gift items such as clothing and artwork, also rents surfboards.

name: Dilly Dally
details: SHOPPING. Clothing, souvenirs, books, postcards, and more. Open Monday-Saturday.

name: The Cove
details: HOTEL $$$. Completely rebuilt, The Cove reopened in 2013 with new rooms, a new beach, and two new restaurants. Has pool and fitness center, free wifi, suites and villas are available. Flight packages are available on The Cove Express.

name: Surfers Manor
details: HOTEL $. 9-room budget hotel is popular for it's location near Surfer's Beach. Restaurant on-site.

name: The Rainbow Inn
details: HOTEL $. Studio style units with kitchenettes, and villa unit with full kitchen. Restaurant on-site, wifi throughout. Short drive to Rainbow Beach, Hatchet Bay Caves, and other popular dining and attractions.

name: Cocodimama
details: HOTEL. Currently closed during renovations, seaside hotel is available for private rentals during construction.

name: Sky Beach Club
details: HOTEL $$$. Luxurious multi-bedroom villas and romantic bungalows with ocean views. Villas have kitchens, wifi, washer/dryer, and plunge pool. Infinity pool, restaurant, and bar on-site.

name: Hut Pointe
details: HOTEL $$. 2-bedroom condo style units with kitchens and wifi. Hotel is directly along main road.

name: The Duck Inn
details: HOTEL $$. Three detached units located in town, all with kitchens. Walking distance to fishing, dining, grocery, shopping, and all the necessities (beer).

name: Pineapple Fields
details: HOTEL $$. Condo style hotel comprised of eight buildings with 1- and 2-bedroom units, all with kitchens, washer/dryer, and wifi. Has community pool. Restaurant and beach located directly across street.

name: Unique Village
details: HOTEL $. Fourteen unit property set on the beach. Activities include pool and tennis courts. On-site restaurant.

name: Northside Inn
details: HOTEL $. Three cottages on the hillside overlooking the beach with ocean views. Restaurant on-site.

name: Forty’s Sports and Rental Shop
details: ACTIVITIES. Rents kayaks, bikes, and arranges fishing trips.

name: Clearwater Dive Shop
details: ACTIVITIES. Rents snorkel equipment, oxygen tanks, and Hawaiian slings.

name: Ocean Fox - Cotton Bay
details: ACTIVITIES. Scuba and snorkel equipment rentals, training, and charters. Departs from Davis Harbour.

name: Ocean Fox - HI
details: ACTIVITIES. Scuba and snorkel equipment rentals, training, and charters.

name: Valentine's Dive Shop
details: ACTIVITIES. Scuba and snorkel equipment rentals, training, and charters.

name: Captain Z's Fishing Charter
details: ACTIVITIES. Fishing and boat charters.

name: Princess Theater
details: ACTIVITIES. Nightly 8:15pm movie showings, except Thursday.

name: Friday Night Fish Fry
details: ACTIVITIES. Friday nights 6pm-12am.

name: Oceanview Farm
details: ACTIVITIES. Mon-Sat 9a-4p, Horseback rides

name: Cape Eleuthera Institute / Island School
details: TOURS. Hosts students for a semester of real world marine biology. Offers tours of the facilities on weekdays, call in advance.

name: Preacher's Cave
details: SIGHTS. Said to have been used by the earliest settlers who crashed nearby. Has been studied extensively for it's historical significance.

name: Current Cut
details: SIGHTS. The changing tide forces water through this narrow passage at high speeds. Popular for snorkelers and divers.

name: Glass Window Bridge
details: SIGHTS. Formerly the narrowest land bridge in the world, the rebuilt road crosses the point where the deep raging Atlantic waters meet the calm shallow water of the Great Bahama Bank.

name: Queen's Bath
details: SIGHTS. Located adjacent to the Cow & Bull rock formation, the Queen's Bath are shallow pools of water found at low tide that offer a place to cool off, and an unbeatable view.

name: Cow and Bull
details: SIGHTS. A rock formation overlooking the ocean. Erosion has given them their bovine-like shapes, further highlighted by a distinct roar through the air on a windy day.

name: Hatchet Bay Caves
details: SIGHTS. Large cave complex can be visited with or without a guide. Bring a flashlight.

name: Rainbow Cliffs
details: SIGHTS. Towering cliffs over the Atlantic form a wave like pattern along the coast. Known for it's cliff diving (use caution) and natural infinity pools formed at low tide.

name: Leon Levy Plant Preserve
details: SIGHTS. Numerous walking trails showing the indigenous plants of the Bahamas. Open daily 9a-5p, $5 adult admission.

name: Ocean Hole
details: SIGHTS. Salt water lake is stocked with various fish. Bring food to feed them or swim alongside, but no fishing allowed.

name: Gully Hole
details: SIGHTS. A small body of dark water. Listed to let you know it's not worth seeing.

name: The Lone Tree
details: SIGHTS. Iconic tree on the beach is a great photo opportunity.

name: Hayne's Library
details: LIBRARY. Has internet access, and also books, like most libraries.

name: Tarpum Bay Library
details: LIBRARY. Has internet access, and also books, like most libraries.

name: Texaco - ELH
details: GAS STATION. West of the airport, at the fork in the road. Useful as a landmark when traveling in the North, and also when filling the take before your departure.

name: Shell - GH
details: GAS STATION. Impossible to miss as you drive through town, directly in front of Eleuthera Supply grocery.

name: Esso - GH
details: GAS STATION. Gas and service station that hopefully you'll never need.

name: Gas - TB
details: GAS STATION. Just north of the Tarpum Bay Shopping Center.

name: Shell - RS
details: GAS STATION. Located in the Market Place Shopping Center.

name: Gas - RS
details: GAS STATION. Great view of the Market Place from this gas station across the street.

name: Gas - GT
details: GAS STATION.  Across from the 7-Eleven in town.

name: Gas - JC
details: GAS STATION. Pump your gas with an ocean view, just north of the fishing pier.

name: Gas - PP
details: GAS STATION. On the main road.

name: Gusty's
details: NIGHTLIFE. Head to the sand dance floor where locals groove with millionaire vacationers.

name: VicHum's
details: NIGHTLIFE. By day, a lounge with food, ping-pong, and a basketball court, by night, a DJ turns it into a dance club.

name: Upper Cove Beach
details: Adjacent to the road and well shaded, the shallow water is better suited for wading than swimming.

name: Tay Bay Beach
details: Located on the north shore, behind Preacher's Cave, this beach is well off the main road, and therefore very quiet.

name: Ben Bay Beach
details: This north shore cove has calm waters that are ideal for swimming and snorkeling.

name: Cistern Cay Beach
details: Shallow water with excellent snorkeling at the cay.

name: Gaulding Cay Beach
details: Calm shallow water, and nice seashells at this quiet Caribbean beach. Great snorkeling just offshore at the cay.

name: Surfer's Beach
details: Known for it's waves, access requires adequate ground clearance and having a 4x4 is helpful.

name: Rainbow Bay Beach
details: Caribbean beach is well maintained by the Rainbow Bay vacation home community and is one of the most active.

name: Twin Beach
details: Scenic beach areas at the bottom of the soaring cliffs. Pedestrian access is difficult, but there are beautiful views from above.

name: James Point Beach
details: The point at the north end of this beach is known as one of the best surfing spots on the island. Sandy access road makes high ground clearance vehicles or 4x4s the preferred transportation.

name: Airport Beach
details: One of largest beaches on the island, this Atlantic side sand is great for long walks.

name: Alabaster Bay Beach
details: The sparkling shallow waters of Alabaster Bay have been enjoyed by many past Cocodimama visitors, and have made their way onto the cover of Conde Nast.

name: Sky Beach
details: Home to Sky Beach Club and The Bistro restaurant, this clean Atlantic beach offers a large berm and is frequently used as a wedding site.

name: Twin Cove Beach
details: Two beaches in one, the coast is shielded from waves and snorkeling in the area is good.

name: French Leave Beach
details: The former home of Club Med, this Atlantic crescent has a gentle slope keeping water shallow near the beach. Dining is available at The Beach House Restaurant.

name: Tippy's Beach
details: Atlantic beach is Overlooked by Tippy's restaurant, has shallow colorful water and a long coastline that's great for walking.

name: Poponi Beach
details: Atlantic beach has a seemingly endless pink sand shoreline with snorkeling opportunities. In a popular vacation rental community, but a relatively quiet beach.

name: Papaw Beach
details: Caribbean beach is somewhat rocky, but has good snorkeling and fishing. Nearby cays can be reached by kayak.

name: Double Bay Beach
details: Atlantic side beach is in a popular vacation rental community, however, it is large and there is plenty of beach to share.

name: Winding Bay Beach
details: Atlantic beach is somewhat sheltered from the waves and has plenty of trees for shade. Beautiful landscape for excellent pictures.

name: Whiteland Beach
details: Atlantic beach, at the north end you'll find the rock formation known as the 'Blue Window' where the sky is framed by the land.

name: Jack's Bay Beach
details: Atlantic beach, just North of Cotton Bay, this crescent has some shade and a gentle entry into the water.

name: Cotton Bay Beach
details: Atlantic beach, located behind the only (decaying) golf course on the island.

name: Lighthouse Bay Beach
details: Atlantic beach, located just prior to the better known Lighthouse Beach, Lighthouse Bay is a crescent of pink sand and bright water at the southern tip of the island with sunshine all day. High ground clearance vehicle preferred for easier access.

name: Lighthouse Beach
details: Atlantic beach with interesting rock formations and the lighthouse on top of the hill make it one of the most picturesque spots on the island. High ground clearance vehicle preferred for easier access.

name: Northside Beach
details: Atlantic beach, extends north and south of the Northside Inn & Restaurant. Afternoon shade from trees and hillside.

name: Pink Sands Beach
details: Harbour Island Beach of abundant pink sand, regularly voted as one of the best in the world. Food and drink at many hill side restaurants, showers and changing facilities are not.

name: Princess Cays
details: PRIVATE. This small area is restricted to Princess Cruise passengers who are free to arrange transport to a quieter part of the island where the non-ship travelers are enjoying the peaceful and non-commercialized beaches.
